main event: A civilian reported observing a circular object in the sky near Pocatello, Idaho on July 22, 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as a blob in the sky traveling at an estimated speed of 2000 mph., The object was circular, about 2 feet in diameter, and silver or white in color., It traveled in a straight line at first, then zig-zagged with a weaving motion., The observation lasted approximately 30 seconds and required rapid head movement to keep the object in sight., The conclusion drawn from the sighting was that it was an astro (meteor).
